bayou.reload

Interface HotCompiler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JavacCompiler, VoidCompiler

    public interface HotCompiler
    Compiler for HotReloader.

    A HotCompiler is registered to a HotReloader through HotReloader.addCompiler(compiler, reload, srcDirs). The source files for the compiler are those under the srcDirs and matching the PathMatcher.

    When source files are created/updated/deleted, the changes are fed to the compile(createdFiles,updatedFiles,deletedFiles) method for recompilation. There is also a compile(allFiles) method for recompiling all source files.

    A HotCompiler usually compiles source files to output files. However it may do something else, e.g. update an external device after a source file is updated.

    An implementation of HotCompiler can be stateful, and not thread-safe. A HotCompiler instance should not be shared, i.e. it should not be used in multiple addCompiler() calls.

    • Method Summary

      Abstract Methods
      PathMatcher getPathMatcher()
      The PathMatcher for source files.
      void compile(Consumer<CharSequence> msgOut, Set<Path> allFiles)

    • Method Detail

      • getPathMatcher

        PathMatcher getPathMatcher()
        The PathMatcher for source files.

        Only those files under the srcDirs will be fed to this PathMatcher; only those approved by this PathMatcher are source files for this compiler.

        An example PathMatcher: FileSystems.getDefault().getPathMatcher("glob:**.java").

        See Also:
        FileSystem.getPathMatcher(String)

      • compile

        void compile(Consumer<CharSequence> msgOut,
             Set<Path> allFiles)
      throws Exception
        Compile all source files.

        This method is usually called in the initial phase of the HotReloader. It may also be called whenever the HotReloader thinks necessary.

        The compiler does not necessarily do a clean build. For example, it may compare timestamps of source files and output files, skip source files that are older than the output files.

        Parameters:
        msgOut - for diagnosis messages; see HotReloader.getMessageOut()
        Throws:
        Exception - if compilation fails; the exception message usually contains compilation errors.

      • compile

        void compile(Consumer<CharSequence> msgOut,
             Set<Path> createdFiles,
             Set<Path> updatedFiles,
             Set<Path> deletedFiles)
      throws Exception
        Compile changed source files.

        This method is called if some source files are created/updated/deleted.

        Parameters:
        msgOut - for diagnosis messages; see HotReloader.getMessageOut()
        Throws:
        Exception - if compilation fails; the exception message usually contains compilation errors.
